required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial of an Audit and Feedback Report to Improve Colonoscopy Performance
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial of an Audit and Feedback Report to Improve Colonoscopy Performance

brief_summary.textblock: This project aims to measure the impact of a physician report card (also called an audit & feedback report) on colonoscopy performance. Endoscopists in Ontario will be randomly assigned to either receive the endoscopist report card or to no feedback. Using Ontario health administrative data, the quality of colonoscopy will be compared between those who received the report card and those who do not. The investigators will also measure the effect of receiving endoscopist report card on colonoscopy performance amongst endoscopists who perform poorly at baseline compared to those who do not. Further, the acceptability of two educational interventions that aim to improve the quality of colonoscopy will be evaluated by conducting one-on-one interviews with select participants. This study is critical to ensure that Canadians have access to the highest quality colonoscopy possible.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in polypectomy rate from baseline
primary_outcome.description: Measure change in polypectomy rate from baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Additional outcome 1- Change in cecal intubation rate
secondary_outcome.description: Change in cecal intubation rate from baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Additional outcome 2 - Change in annual colonoscopy volume
secondary_outcome.description: Change in annual colonoscopy volume from baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Additional outcome 3 - Change in poor bowel preparation rate
secondary_outcome.description: Change in poor bowel preparation rate from baseline

arm_group.description: Half of the endoscopists in Ontario will receive an individualized audit & feedback report. Individualized A/F report.
Half of the endoscopists in Ontario will NOT receive an individualized audit & feedback report.
All endoscopists in Ontario will receive an individualized audit & feedback report at month 12. Individualized A/F report

In Round 2, selected 60 poorer performers will be randomly assigned to receive one of the following interventions at month 12: A/F report plus a high intensity intervention A/F report plus a low intensity intervention A/F report alone

intervention.description: Individualized A/F report containing 9 colonoscopy quality measures.

intervention.intervention_name: A/F report plus a high intensity intervention
A/F report plus a low intensity intervention
intervention.description: E.g. Access to a video/presentation on good colonoscopy technique followed by a post presentation assessment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All practising endoscopists in Ontario who performed at least 5 colonoscopies in 2014
Exclusion Criteria:
